Key Arguments: Regulation of information may lead to censorship of pertinent information.
Balancing freedom of speech is impossible if platforms are pressured to remove information.
Some information initially deemed misinformation has later been proven accurate.
Government narratives during the pandemic, such as lockdowns and vaccines, were misleading.
Notable Quotes: The absence of pertinent information poses a greater threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians.
If any information can be removed as a result of pressure on platforms... then no 'balancing freedom of speech' is possible.
It is now clear these very measures in fact posed a great threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians, our society and economy.
